get.description: You can use this endpoints to fetch all the accounts tied to a business. Accounts are sorted by date, with the most recently-created account appearing first.

parameters.description: The parent accountId of the business.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: This endpoint is paginated. `limit` describes the size of the page you are querying
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The `cursor` is used to scroll to the next page. When making the first call to list all accounts, there is no need to pass in any cursor since the API has not returned any cursor back to you. Only use cursor when the API provides it
parameters.name: cursor

results.description: Contains all accounts tied to a specific merchant/business

items.description: A structure representing a Nomba account.

accountHolderId.description: The businessId of the parent that houses this account.

accountRef.description: Unique reference used to track an account from an external process. Would be auto-generated if not provided at the point of creation.

phoneNumber.description: The phoneNumber that is unique to the account bearer.

bvn.description: Bank verification number of the account bearer.

banks.description: Contains all the bank details tied to a Nomba account

items.description: A structure representing a bank account

bankAccountNumber.description: The bank account number tied to the Nomba account.

currency.description: Primary currency on the account (Only supported at the moment is “NGN”).

createdAt.description: The date and time this entity was created. This value uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and ISO 8601 format – `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

updatedAt.description: The date and time this entity was updated. This value uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and ISO 8601 format – `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

cursor.description: Value used to scroll to next page. It will be empty if there is no more page to scroll to

BankAccountTransferRequest.description: A structure representing an object required to post a bank account transfer.

bankCode.description: The code of the recipient bank.

merchantTxRef.description: Unique reference used to track a transaction from an external process.

BankAccountLookupRequest.description: A structure representing a bank account lookup request

accountNumber.description: The account number to be looked up.

bankCode.description: The bankCode of the bank the account number belongs to. This can be obtained from a call to `/v1/transfers/bank`

BankAccountLookupResult.description: A structure representing a bank account lookup result

accountNumber.description: The account number already looked up.

results.description: Contains result of all banks fetched

IssueTokenRequest.description: A structure representing an authentication request.

grant_type.description: The grant type of the authentication.

client_id.description: The client's id as obtained from your Nomba dashboard.

client_secret.description: The client's secret as obtained from your Nomba dashboard. It is securely generated by the Nomba system

IssueTokenResponse.description: A structure representing an authentication result.

businessId.description: The accountId of the merchant/business that is connecting to the Nomba system via API

access_token.description: A JWT (Json Web Token) token used to grant access to resources on the Nomba API.

refresh_token.description: A Base64 Encoded String used to refresh an expired access_token

expiresAt.description: The date and time this entity was created. This value uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and ISO 8601 format – `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

RefreshTokenRequest.description: A structure representing a refresh token request.

grant_type.description: The grant type of the authentication.

refresh_token.description: A Base64 Encoded String used to refresh an expired access_token

RevokeTokenRequest.description: A structure representing a request to revoke a token.

clientId.description: The client's id as obtained from your Nomba dashboard.

access_token.description: The JWT (Json Web Token) token to be revoked

RevokeTokenResponse.description: A structure representing a response from an attempt to revoke a token

code.description: Tells if the access_token has been revoked

description.description: Describes the result of the action performed

cursor.description: Cursor for pagination. It will be empty if there is no more page to scroll to

WalletTransferRequest.description: A structure representing an object required to post a wallet transfer.

merchantTxRef.description: Unique reference used to track a transaction from an external process.

cursor.description: Cursor for pagination. It will be empty if there is no more page to scroll to
Cursor for pagination. It will be empty if there is no more page to scroll to

BearerAuth.description: Nomba authenticates API calls with [OAuth2 HTTP bearer tokens](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750). There are two methods of authentication; [Client-Credentials method](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6749) and [PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange)](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7636) method. In each of the methods, You will get an `ACCESS_TOKEN`. You need to use an `"Authorization"` HTTP header to provide your `ACCESS_TOKEN`. For example: `Authorization: {ACCESS_TOKEN}`. More details about Nomba's Oauth Authentication can be found on [NombaAPI Specification Doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/10mn6LeYpxVe9gr0hdDThUKJmpZW9X1dI3OaMu_vuUis/edit?usp=sharing)
